content.description:
Pounding Pity is a short, power problem that climbs a solid overhang in cramped quarters.

Sit start with a sloping right hand jug and a left hand matched on it. From there, reach a left hand incut edge/finger-lock, match a toe on the start hold, follow to a right hand crimp, stick the lip, follow the lip slightly to the left, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads worked well. Despite the cramped quarters and present rocks, the problem is quite safe and free of obstacles.
content.location: It climbs the southeast corner of Seven Four Stone.

content.description: Stand start with a high right hand edge and a low left hand edge. From there, find a right foot edge that can propel you up and left, follow the good holds out left, and head up for an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The start is uneven but pads nicely.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Seven Four Stone.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched on the horizontal edge. From there, move up to and match hands on the oblique mail slot, then hit the sloping, right hand jug which accesses the relief and subsequent topout.

The feet are tricky starting out, but with the right smears, they go.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work, the landing is good, but it's slightly sloping.
content.location: It climbs the center-north face of Seven Four.
